Context:
The George Brown College Foundation is led by directors with a strong commitment to the college's goals and objectives. Erin Griffiths, Chair of the Board of Directors, is the Senior Vice President, Client Solutions at Scotiabank, responsible for various business units including Scotia Wealth Management and Scotiatrust. She has over 20 years of industry experience and sits on several boards and speaks frequently at industry events. Erin holds a BA in Sociology from Queen's University and an MBA from York University.

Leen Yong Li, Chair of the Finance and Investment Committees, is the CEO of the Wealthsimple Foundation, dedicated to enabling access to post-secondary education in Canada. She has over 20 years of experience in finance and technology and holds an MBA in Finance from St. Mary's University. Born in China, she came to Canada as an international student in her mid-twenties and held various C-level positions including CFO at Wealthsimple and VP at Influitive, Medchart, #movethedial, and Pressly.

Cindy, a director, is an accomplished leader with over [amount redacted] years of experience. Dr. Cindy Gouveia's tenure and accomplishments are not detailed in the provided text.

Context:
Cindy Gouveia:
- Director President, George Brown College Foundation
- Over 20 years of management experience in the private and public sectors
- Holds a Ph.D. in higher education from the University of Toronto
- Holds a Master of Business Administration degree from the University of Guelph
- Travelled overseas to establish cross-cultural partnerships

Chris Campbell:
- Director Vice President, Toronto Carpenters' Union Local 27
- Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion Representative, Carpenters' District Council of Ontario (CDCO)
- Graduate of George Brown College’s School of Apprenticeship & Skilled Trades
- Member of the Carpenters Union for 32 years
- Full-time staff representative for 19 years
- Focused on addressing issues of racism and fighting discriminatory hiring practices
- Plays a major role in recruiting youth from his community to pursue careers in the construction trade
- On several boards and committees including the Carpenters’ Union Benefits and Pension Plan Board of Trustees, the Carpenters' Union local 27 Executive Board, Board Chair of the Toronto Community Benefits Network, Executive Board Member of the Coalition of Black Trade Unionist, Toronto Crime Stoppers Board Member, The Toronto Police Black Community Consultative Committee, and the Carpenters’ Union Equity Diversity and Inclusion Committee

Dr. Gervan Fearon:
- Director President, George Brown College (since August 2021)
- Aims to support career-oriented programs, advance college-led research, and enhance community engagement
- Proven track record of collaboration, transformative leadership, and engaging higher learning communities in a shared mission.

Context:
Gervan Fearon is the President and Vice-Chancellor of George Brown College. He has a Ph.D. in economics from the University of Western Ontario and master’s and Bachelor of Science degrees in agricultural economics from the University of Guelph. He holds a Chartered Professional Accountant designation (CPA, CGA) and Institute of Corporate Directors designation (ICD.D).

Dr. Fearon has a strong professional background in post-secondary education. Prior to joining George Brown College, he was the President and Vice-Chancellor at Brock University (2017-2021) and Brandon University (2014-2017). He also held numerous progressive roles including Dean of the G. Raymond Chang School of Continuing Education at Ryerson University; Associate Dean at York University’s Atkinson Faculty of Liberal and Professional Studies; Visiting Scholar at the University of Washington; and as an Associate Professor at York University.

Dr. Fearon also has a strong teaching and research record. His career included serving as the Executive Assistant to the Deputy Minister at the Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs and a Senior Analyst at the Treasury Board, Ontario Ministry of Finance. He has also served on numerous community boards, including Ontario Trillium Foundation, Brandon Urban Aboriginal Peoples’ Council, United Way Niagara, Greater Niagara Chamber of Commerce, and the Chinese Cultural Centre of Greater Toronto. He was also Co-Chair of the Niagara Region’s Community Safety and Well-Being Planning Committee, Chair of the Budget and Audit Committee of Council of Ontario Universities, and President of Tropicana Community Services.

Dr. Fearon is a recipient of several awards including the Queen Elizabeth II Diamond Jubilee Medal (2013), The Michaëlle Jean Foundation Influencer Award (2017), and The University of the West Indies Vice-Chancellor's Award (2020).

Richard Gill is the Vice President, Treasury Strategy, Capital Planning and Analysis at Equitable Bank. Prior to this role, he was the Vice President of Corporate Development and Investor Relations at Equitable, where he drove the execution of the largest acquisition in the Bank’s history.
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/Board of Directors | George Brown College.txt

Context:
Richard brings 15+ years of industry experience in corporate strategy, investment banking, corporate finance, and treasury to the George Brown College Foundation Board. He established the Bank's investor relations and environmental, social, and corporate governance functions after leading the largest acquisition in the Bank’s history. A first generation Canadian, Richard moved to Canada from India at 14 and holds a Master of Finance and MBA from the Rotman School of Management, University of Toronto, as well as a BCom from the University of British Columbia. He is a Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA, CA).

Michelle S. Henry has significant legal expertise and is a Partner at Borden Ladner Gervais, LLP. She serves on the Federal Judicial Advisory Committee for the GTA and co-founded the Black Business Law Clinic. Michelle holds a Masters in English and a J.D. from the University of Toronto and is the recipient of the 2021 Ontario Bar Association Pro Bono Award.

Leslie McLean has over 30 years of experience in health care, holding a Bachelor of Arts Degree from Mount Allison University, a Bachelor of Science in Nursing degree from McMaster University, and her Master of Science in Nursing (Ethics) from Dalhousie University.
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/Board of Directors | George Brown College.txt

Context:
Leslie:
- Passionate about education and creating healthy work environments for healthcare providers
- Adjunct professor at Dalhousie University's School of Nursing in Halifax teaching oncology nursing and supervising graduate students
- International work and volunteer experience in Africa, Central America, India, and Norway focusing on health and social justice concerns
- Serves on a large number of local and national professional and not-for-profit committees and boards
- Currently providing consulting services in collaborative practice, compassion fatigue, and ethical issues in clinical practice

Damon Murchison:
- President and CEO of IG Wealth Management
- Over 25 years' experience in financial investment management
- Received MBA through the Executive MBA Program at Ivey Business School, London, Ontario

Ray Williams:
- Managing Director and Vice Chairman, Financial Markets, National Bank Financial
- Extensive experience in Cash and Derivatives products, Infrastructure Financing, Provincial & Federal Liability Management, Mortgage Finance Companies (MFC) Financing and Hedging of Securitized Product
- Committed to community engagement, particularly in the area of diversity and inclusion efforts
- Serves on leadership boards for various organizations, including 100Strong Foundation
- Founding past president and member of Canadian Association of Urban Financial Professionals (CAUFP)
- Co-founder of the Black Opportunity Fund.
